SubTopics: Demonstrate fluency with the multiplication of two whole numbers up to a three-digit number by a two-digit number using the standard algorithm.
Content: A supermarket has 238 large boxes of cereal. Each large box holds 32 small bags of cereal. How many small bags of cereal are in the supermarket?

SubTopics: Compute and solve real-world problems with multi-digit whole numbers and decimal numbers.
Content: Richard walked 15.74 miles and James walked 12.98 miles. How many more miles did Richard walk than James?

SubTopics: Use fractions to model and solve division problems.
Content: After basketball practice, 8 players equally shared 3 large bottles of water. What fraction of a bottle did each player get?

SubTopics: Apply and extend previous understandings of multiplication to multiply a fraction or whole number by a fraction, including mixed numbers.
Content: Joan went to the bookstore.

:ibox:• At this bookstore, 3/4 of the books are fiction.
• Of the fiction books, 1/3 are mystery books.
What fraction of the books at the bookstore are mystery fiction books?

SubTopics: Solve one-step word problems involving division of unit fractions by non-zero whole numbers and division of whole numbers by unit fractions using area and length models, and equations to represent the problem.
Content: A school painted 1/2 of a wall in its gym with 3 colors. Each color takes up the same amount of space on the wall. What fraction of the wall does each color occupy?

SubTopics: Add and subtract fractions, including mixed numbers, with unlike denominators using related fractions: halves, fourths and eighths; thirds, sixths, and twelfths; fifths, tenths, and hundredths.
Content: Tracie ran a total of 5 3/4 miles on Saturday and Sunday. She ran 1 5/8 miles on Saturday. How many miles did Tracie run on Sunday?

SubTopics: Find quotients with remainders when dividing whole numbers with up to four-digit dividends and two-digit divisors using rectangular arrays, area models, repeated subtraction, partial quotients, and/or the relationship between multiplication and division. Use models to make connections and develop the algorithm.
Content: A sports store has 468 golf balls. They will be put into boxes that hold 18 balls each. What is the MINIMUM number of boxes needed for all of the golf balls?

SubTopics: Use fractions to model and solve division problems.
Content: Three pizzas are shared equally among 12 people. What fraction of a pizza will each person get?

SubTopics: Add and subtract fractions, including mixed numbers, with unlike denominators using related fractions: halves, fourths and eighths; thirds, sixths, and twelfths; fifths, tenths, and hundredths.
Content: What is the value of n in the equation shown?
problems/NC18G5M/media/9a.jpg

SubTopics: Use fractions to model and solve division problems.
Content: Mr. Edwards bought a 50-pound bag of flour for his bakery. It was equally divided among 6 days. How much flour was used per day?

SubTopics: Apply and extend previous understandings of multiplication to multiply a fraction or whole number by a fraction, including mixed numbers.
Content: A rectangular room is 12 1/2 feet long and 10 1/3 feet wide. What is the area of the room?

SubTopics: Add and subtract fractions, including mixed numbers, with unlike denominators using related fractions: halves, fourths and eighths; thirds, sixths, and twelfths; fifths, tenths, and hundredths.
Content: Trisha bought a carton of orange juice. She drank 1/3 of the carton on Monday and 5/12 of the carton on Tuesday. What fraction of the carton did Trisha drink?

SubTopics: Solve one-step word problems involving division of unit fractions by non-zero whole numbers and division of whole numbers by unit fractions using area and length models, and equations to represent the problem.
Content: Three friends equally share 1/2 of a pizza. How much of the pizza does each friend get?

SubTopics: Write, explain, and evaluate numerical expressions involving the four operations to solve up to two-step problems.
Content: Mia wants to buy 3 notebooks for $1.29 each. Which expression shows how to find the total cost?

SubTopics: Add and subtract fractions, including mixed numbers, with unlike denominators using related fractions: halves, fourths and eighths; thirds, sixths, and twelfths; fifths, tenths, and hundredths.
Content: What is the value of 1/6 + 1/12 + 2/6?

SubTopics: Demonstrate fluency with the multiplication of two whole numbers up to a three-digit number by a two-digit number using the standard algorithm.
Content: A business has 384 cases of water. There are 42 bottles of water in each case. How many bottles of water does the business have?

SubTopics: Find quotients with remainders when dividing whole numbers with up to four-digit dividends and two-digit divisors using rectangular arrays, area models, repeated subtraction, partial quotients, and/or the relationship between multiplication and division. Use models to make connections and develop the algorithm.
Content: A rope that is 6 meters long will be cut into 24 pieces that are all of the same length. What will be the length of each piece, in centimeters?
(Note: 100 centimeters = 1 meter)

SubTopics: Add and subtract fractions, including mixed numbers, with unlike denominators using related fractions: halves, fourths and eighths; thirds, sixths, and twelfths; fifths, tenths, and hundredths.
Content: Wayne exercised for 5/6 of an hour in the morning and 1/3 of an hour in the evening. How much more of an hour did Wayne spend exercising in the morning than in the evening?

SubTopics: Apply and extend previous understandings of multiplication to multiply a fraction or whole number by a fraction, including mixed numbers.
Content: What is the area of the square, in square units?
problems/NC18G5M/media/19a.jpg

SubTopics: Demonstrate fluency with the multiplication of two whole numbers up to a three-digit number by a two-digit number using the standard algorithm.
Content: A factory delivered 284 boxes of books to stores. There are 20 books in each box. How many books did the factory deliver?

SubTopics: Relate volume to the operations of multiplication and addition.
Content: What is the volume of the figure, in cubic centimeters?
problems/NC18G5M/media/21a.jpg

SubTopics: Demonstrate fluency with the multiplication of two whole numbers up to a three-digit number by a two-digit number using the standard algorithm.
Content: A school has 45 classrooms. There are 27 students in each classroom. How many students are in all 45 classrooms?

SubTopics: Compute and solve real-world problems with multi-digit whole numbers and decimal numbers.
Content: Each large square has a value of one.
problems/NC18G5M/media/23a.jpg
What is the value of the shaded parts of the large squares?

SubTopics: Solve one-step word problems involving division of unit fractions by non-zero whole numbers and division of whole numbers by unit fractions using area and length models, and equations to represent the problem.
Content: Eight gardeners equally share 1/2 of a pile of pine needles. What fraction of the pile does each gardener receive?

SubTopics: Relate volume to the operations of multiplication and addition.
Content: What is the volume of the rectangular prism, in cubic cm?
problems/NC18G5M/media/25a.jpg

SubTopics: Graph points in the first quadrant of a coordinate plane, and identify and interpret the x and y coordinates to solve problems.
Content: Katie will complete a square on the coordinate plane.
problems/NC18G5M/media/26a.jpg
Which coordinate pair will complete this square?

SubTopics: Given a conversion chart, use multiplicative reasoning to solve one-step conversion problems within a given measurement system.
Content: The length of a shoe is 25 centimeters. How long is the shoe in meters?
(Note: 1 meter = 100 centimeters)

SubTopics: Represent and interpret data.
Content: The height of a boy, from age 3 to age 8, is shown on the line graph.
problems/NC18G5M/media/28a.jpg
How many inches did the boy grow between 5 and 8 years of age?

SubTopics: Write, explain, and evaluate numerical expressions involving the four operations to solve up to two-step problems.
Content: Which expression matches the words “eight less than the product of twelve and four”?

SubTopics: Compute and solve real-world problems with multi-digit whole numbers and decimal numbers.
Content: Alyssa walked 1.34 fewer miles than Emily. Alyssa walked 2.56 miles. How many miles did Emily walk?

SubTopics: Apply and extend previous understandings of multiplication to multiply a fraction or whole number by a fraction, including mixed numbers.
Content: What is the area of the rectangle?
problems/NC18G5M/media/31a.jpg

SubTopics: Write, explain, and evaluate numerical expressions involving the four operations to solve up to two-step problems.
Content: Regina has 3 bags of marbles. There are 25 marbles in each bag. She wants to put an equal number of marbles into 5 bags. Which expression would show how many marbles can go in each bag?

SubTopics: Generate two numerical patterns using two given rules.
Content: Lou has two sets of numbers.

:ibox:• The first set starts with 3 and follows a pattern of increasing by 5.
• The second set starts with 39 and follows a pattern of decreasing by 6.
How many numbers do the two sets have in common?

SubTopics: Classify quadrilaterals into categories based on their properties.
Content: Mr. Parker is graphing a quadrilateral. He wants the quadrilateral to be a trapezoid. He has already graphed vertices at (1, 1), (3, 3), and (5, 3). Which choice is a point that could be the 4th vertex?

SubTopics: Solve one-step word problems involving division of unit fractions by non-zero whole numbers and division of whole numbers by unit fractions using area and length models, and equations to represent the problem.
Content: Mr. Wilson bought a bag of birdseed and put half of it in his bird feeder. He split the other half equally among his 4 pet birds. How much of the bag did each pet bird get?

SubTopics: Represent and interpret data.
Content: The line graph shows the monthly attendance at a fun park for a year.
problems/NC18G5M/media/36a.jpg
Which statement describes the data on the line graph?

A.Choice: The highest attendance was during January and February.

B.Choice: The attendance decreased between October and November.

C.Choice: The lowest attendance was during September and October.

D.Choice: The attendance increased between July and August.

SubTopics: Given a conversion chart, use multiplicative reasoning to solve one-step conversion problems within a given measurement system.
Content: How many feet are in 2,241 inches?
(Note: 1 foot = 12 inches)

SubTopics: Generate two numerical patterns using two given rules.
Content: A pattern of ordered pairs is shown.
The pattern continues. What is the EIGHTH ordered pair in the pattern?

SubTopics: Read, write, and compare decimals to thousandths.
Content: Which choice is the expanded form for 602.049?
